thread.title: Mumbai University postpones exams for 10 postgraduate courses
thread.title_full: Mumbai University postpones exams for 10 postgraduate courses - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Mumbai University postpones exams for 10 postgraduate courses
text:
MUMBAI: The University of Mumbai has postponed the exam dates of 10 postgraduate courses, including Semester-I exams for MA and MSc, due to late admissions this year. A few of the exams have been postponed by over a month. The exam dates for credit-based grading system Semester-I MA and MSc, MSc Research (Sem-I), MA (Hons) in Sociology (Sem-I and III), TYBA (5-year integrated course in Russian) (Sem-V), MA (Hons) in Politics (Sem-I and III), and MA (Hons) in Public Policy (Sem-II) have been postponed due to late results followed by delay in admissions. The TYBCom (Sem-VI) paper on October 29 has been rescheduled as it clashed with a CA exam.
The university has put up the notice on its website and has asked colleges to inform their students.
A principal said the late exams and delayed assessment will have a bearing on the next term too. "The MU will have to bring about serious reforms or this cycle will continue to affect all exams."
